citations.narrative:
The applicant is not following the vaccination schedule in the written Program of Veterinary Care (PVC). The PVC
prescribes for the parvovirus and distemper vaccinations for adults to be performed yearly. The adult dogs last received
their parvovirus and distemper vaccinations on 11/30/2022. The adult dogs are not up to date on the required
vaccinations for distemper and parvovirus and are overdue.
Failure to administer vaccines in accordance with a veterinary approved schedule can increase the risk of disease
exposure and disease transmission, and cause illness to the animals. Correct by ensuring all animals are vaccinated in
accordance with the guidelines and schedule approved by the Attending Veterinarian.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “A” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by June 8, 2024 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
n

narrative:
3.13(a)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The applicant is not following the vaccination schedule in the written Program of Veterinary Care (PVC). The PVC 
prescribes for the parvovirus and distemper vaccinations for adults to be performed yearly. The adult dogs last received 
their parvovirus and distemper vaccinations on 11/30/2022. The adult dogs are not up to date on the required 
vaccinations for distemper and parvovirus and are overdue. 
 
Failure to administer vaccines in accordance with a veterinary approved schedule can increase the risk of disease 
exposure and disease transmission, and cause illness to the animals. Correct by ensuring all animals are vaccinated in 
accordance with the guidelines and schedule approved by the Attending Veterinarian. 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “A” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by June 8, 2024 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee 
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires. 
 
 n
